title: The banning system has no logic in it
body:
I play this game for about two years and today was the first time i got a 10 games chat ban.  on the first game i said the word "idiot" 5 times,4 times "trash" and one time "fucking" (the original sentence was "fucking vlad dmg" but the banning bot algorithm is poor so it cant understand the meaning behind it)
second game i typed "pussy" 5 times (team was not doing anything, just staying behind afraid to fight but that doesnt matter), also i said one time "bad adc" and "shut up"... really "Bad" words. 
so if i got banned i came to a conclusion that the bot must count the "bad words" in the chat logs, thats the only way this really bad and poor algorithm works, if riot was actually good at programming they would program AI on the software and the bot could be able to understand what is the meaning behind every sentence, but riot is not a quality company like blizzard. so the bot just count words. since riot says u need to play to win to get honor up, i assume the word "surrender" can be scanned as bad. so i entered a game on my smurf, and spammed "surrender", for about 20 times. i played the game normally and didnt write anything else. at the end i got a warning...(since this is a lvl 15 smurf probably).
conclusion: the system is very poor... what kind of stupid algorithm is that? literally counting "bad words" (i mean the word "idiot" is not even bad i dont believe anyone feels hurted after that, i wouldnt care if someone calls me an idiot the whole game, but words like kill your self can actually hurt. same goes for "shut up" and "trash")
as a software engineering student, i dont understand why in 2019 riot doesnt use AI which is the normal algorithms nowadays. just a trash company, only if blizzard had this game...

replies.body: As a software engineering student, you probably should try to learn the system before talk like you know what it is.

> [{quoted}](name=zPOOPz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-07-22T11:53:59.932+0000)
>
> As a software engineering student, you probably should try to learn the system before talk like you know what it is.

this is the only way this system can work if you get banned for that, ive seen alot of videos too. there is no human checking the chat logs unless you send a ticket, try exploring the internet you will see everyone say the same. also i have friends who play this game from season 2 and 3, they say the same that the banning system has been always bad (they didnt even get banned they just know it because literally everyone said it over and over).
from my expierence the only way this system can be so bad is that its not based on AI. i guess a better algorithm is too much for riot, after all this is not google here.
What if I told you the system is a machine learning system that learns toxicity based on people report pattern?

> [{quoted}](name=zPOOPz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2019-07-22T12:21:25.146+0000)
>
> What if I told you the system is a machine learning system that learns toxicity based on people report pattern?

then this makes no logic at all according to so much examples of chat logs. also reports are bugged. i once played with 3 premades and we reported the last player who was trolling and flaming and he wasnt even banned, 4 reports. and that happened after he was doing the same the last game before according to his match history

> [{quoted}](name=me op mid,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2019-07-22T12:29:08.504+0000)
>
> then this makes no logic at all according to so much examples of chat logs. also reports are bugged. i once played with 3 premades and we reported the last player who was trolling and flaming and he wasnt even banned, 4 reports. and that happened after he was doing the same the last game before according to his match history

It is just as true that more reports increase the likelihood of a punishment as it is that the system looks for bad words and ignores context... that is, not at all.

As a software engineering student, you need to learn to look up [documentation](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player) for the systems you use.
He's technically half right.  The system does look for ZT that's more or less a word filter.

> [{quoted}](name=me op mid,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2019-07-22T12:29:08.504+0000)
>
> then this makes no logic at all according to so much examples of chat logs. also reports are bugged. i once played with 3 premades and we reported the last player who was trolling and flaming and he wasnt even banned, 4 reports. and that happened after he was doing the same the last game before according to his match history

Reports are not given any extra weight just because multiple people report the same person in a single game. All the system cares about is **IF** a person was reported in a game. Any extra reports have no effect. When it comes to trolling, the system is simply not going to be very good at that and usually has to wait for a manual review for such situations. The ambiguity of detecting if someone was making mistakes intentionally or unintentionally makes a computer inadequate at making accurate decisions in many trolling cases.

You're not in control over what punishment the system gives nor are you aware of their standing with the system. They could have received a chat restriction or they may not have been pushed into their next punishment yet.

The feedback system that informs you if someone was punished due to your report is sporadic at best. Not receiving it is not an indication of anything.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player

I hate to tell you this, but just because you got punished doesn't mean the report system is bugged and the punishment system is flawed. In fact, it's **exactly the opposite**. It's working as intended. Whether you want to accept it or not, you spent the entire time insulting and berating your teammates, and there's a good chance you've done it in many games previously, hence why you finally got punished.

Accept and move on.

If all **you** look at is the "bad words" then that's all you'll see.

Maybe you should post your chat logs so we can help you identify the**behaviors** that got you punished, because that's actually how the system works.

*edit*, just noticed you did post them. Both of those games are full of you insulting and berating others, and that's what you were punished for. Not the words you used.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2019-07-22T12:19:52.451+0000)
>
> If all **you** look at is the "bad words" then that's all you'll see.
> 
> Maybe you should post your chat logs so we can help you identify the**behaviors** that got you punished, because that's actually how the system works.
> 
> *edit*, just noticed you did post them. Both of those games are full of you insulting and berating others, and that's what you were punished for. Not the words you used.

what do u mean, the insults are the words...

No, this is where you don't make sense. You ask for am AI, but then you keep going back to the words. Riot doesn't punish for words. They punish for how you use the words.
Saying "I'm an idiot" won't get you punished. Calling your teammates an idiot will. The system does not simply look at the words you use. It looks at the sentences you form with those words and the overall attitude of your chat log.

It doesn't matter if you used the words "idiot", "trash", "bad", and "pussy" - you could've replaced those words with "banana" and there's still enough in your logs that it would be obvious you are insulting and belittling others. It's not the words you use that get you punished, it's the attitude you have towards your teammates.

>as a software engineering student, i dont understand why in 2019 riot doesnt use AI which is the normal algorithms nowadays.

Riot does use AI. The only time word-matching is used as a primary filter is if zero-tolerance behavior (hate speed, encouragements to self-harm) are involved.

That said, your chat logs make it *immediately* apparent that you're aiming at insulting people. Riot uses more than a word-match, but really you *wouldn't* need more than a word-match to tell from the frequency with which you use words like "trash," "idiot," and "pussies" that you're being insulting and abusive to your team. If this is behavior you feel should be acceptable, please find another game.

>me op mid: idiot
me op mid: fucking trash tryhards
me op mid: trashes
me op mid: plats and golds trashes
me op mid: trash gold
me op mid: IDIOT I HAVE 70 GAMES
me op mid: YOU IDIOT
me op mid: do u have anythning else to say you complete idiot
me op mid: you suck dicks
me op mid: everyone here suck
me op mid: thank u idiots
me op mid: trash
me op mid: complete trash golds
me op mid: that u are the one who wasting time here idiot
me op mid: pussies
me op mid: u pussy guys just watch
me op mid: ur silver shut up
me op mid: u are pussy team
me op mid: you tryhard pussie
me op mid: end the game pussies
me op mid: but u guys suck hard
me op mid: this pussy

In short, ***your log is very toxic***. The fact that you'd rather attribute this to a bad detection system is a sign that you refuse to acknowledge that, in which case I would expect you to receive additional punishments once this one is over. All that happened here is that the AI caught you for a pretty problematic log that HAPPENS to repeat the same bad words frequently -- but a quick glance through these boards will show that it can pick up on a LOT more than just that.

Borderline toxic, you spent time insuting and rank-shaming instead of encouraging & giving positive calls for your teammates.
I don't see that the banning system failed.
You deserved it.
his logs are FAR past borderline...

> [{quoted}](name=Fönikku,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-07-22T11:56:50.479+0000)
>
> Borderline toxic, you spent time insuting and rank-shaming instead of encouraging & giving positive calls for your teammates.
> I don't see that the banning system failed.
> You deserved it.

but you dont think... do u think anyone would actually feel hurt from that shit talk? like wtf is this game school or something?
they trying to educate us to be the nicest people on earth? this is bullshit, toxic people can be nice people on real life because THIS IS A GAME like why the hell would i care about randoms talknig shit in a game?
if someone rank shaming me then what? i will go cry? who cares about talknig shit. what i wrote is just bunch of shit talk and thats all, how can anyone be ofended from that? in real life you will see much worse things...
also why do i even need to "encourage and give positive calls"? its like they are trying to make us "sportsmanlike" when this is a goddamn game where u get nothing from winning or losing. this is not a real "sport". they expect players to be sportsmanlike on a video game? maybe on competitions but on goddamn normal or soloq? who cares... this is for fun! not for the win.

> do u think anyone would actually feel hurt from that shit talk?

It doesn't matter **if** someone would be hurt from it. The point is that you're **derailing the game for everyone else** by spewing negative shit instead of playing the game. The rules are quite simple - don't be a jerk.

> like wtf is this game school or something?

Lessons we learned in school apply to all sorts of scenarios, including online gaming. Here's the lesson from school, modified for adulthood: "If you don't have anything nice to say, shut the fuck up."

Your whole premise is "I think this is how the system works. I invented data to confirm my own biases; therefore my biases were confirmed."

Fortunately for you, the system is far more nuanced than "counting bad words". It does take into account the context of the sentence. And pretty much every single sentence was punishable both by a 'context of the sentence' system and by your own 'here's the strawman I made up' system.

Let's look at your logs. Here are the only two lines you said that were not harassing another player.

>me op mid: who cares
me op mid: i paly for fun

Literally every other line of text was in some way a violation of the summoner's code. Stop flaming teammates and opponents. Also, swearing by itself is not against the rules. You can swear if you fucking want to. This, however:

>me op mid: fucking trash tryhards

Is not saying "fucking vlad damage", which would not be punishable by itself. 

With regards to the "surrender" spam, absolutely. You're deliberately being obnoxious to teammates. Don't deliberately be obnoxious to teammates.

>

> 
> With regards to the "surrender" spam, absolutely. You're deliberately being obnoxious to teammates. Don't deliberately be obnoxious to teammates.

my theory is based on many people who got banned, and also people who didnt but they have more expierence in the game, atleast 8 years. also i know a programmer in blizzard who explained me abit how thier system works in overwatch and more. (i have played overwatch for 2 years also and never got banned, how is that?) from what he said it was obv thier system is 10 times smarter than riot, i dont even need to prove that riot system is poor, because everyone knows that riot does not care about quality, it is well known and you cant say this is a quality company, which is why i am so sure the algorithm must be poor, like many other things in the game. the only thing holding this game alive are changes and creativity by the balance team. there are so much changes every patch... so much champions and people ignore the fact that this game is a complete trash game if you talk about graphics/bugs/client and more. it is obvious that riot are not using softwares like blizzard because they DONT NEED to make the game's code actually good, they just need to keep being creative at the balance team. 
you can rarely see they are adding very little things to the part of the game that is not balance, like the loading screen, client, etc. most of the time they are dealing with balance and not techincal issues (except bugs, but there will be new bugs right after anyway). why do u think they are not focusing on things that are not balance? because this is not thier way to get money. simple as that.

Edit: all of that and i didnt even talk about MMR and matchmaking system which is the worst system in this game with many players complaning over and over.

go play blizzard games
i've played since season 2
i've personally never been even chat restricted
and i've said worse things

the difference being i say those things once or twice a month
and you probably get reported on a daily basis

so i can say worse things once or  twice a month for 7 years?
do u understand how sad is that the system cant determine you are toxic if you do this? because you say worse things, and u do not reform basicly... you just dont write it alot but u keep writing it 1 or 2 times a month... i think this is considered toxic if the words are actually bad.  i dont even understand how the words i said are "bad words"... like anyone would cry after i tell him trash or idiot? im not  telling him to suicide or get cancer.

the system punishes for repeated offenses or extreme cases

if you start hard verbal abuse or racial/sexist comments you will get banned for 1 game
but saying fucking r%%%%% once will not get you banned

everyone slips up if you've watched rioters play you would notice that they sometimes flame as well

not everyone can have full control of their emotions and impulses always
but you not having any control of those emotions and impulses validates a punishment

consider yourself lucky that you got chat restricted
there are plenty of people making posts on these boards for getting 14 day bans and permanent bans for similar offenses to yours

> [{quoted}](name=me op mid,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-07-22T11:51:47.555+0000)
>
> so i can say worse things once or  twice a month for 7 years?
> do u understand how sad is that the system cant determine you are toxic if you do this? because you say worse things, and u do not reform basicly... you just dont write it alot but u keep writing it 1 or 2 times a month... i think this is considered toxic if the words are actually bad.  i dont even understand how the words i said are "bad words"... like anyone would cry after i tell him trash or idiot? im not  telling him to suicide or get cancer.

You cant INSULT players. Calling people trash and idiots is obviously insulting people. It doesnt matter if you usethe new trendy insults, or the classics like idiot. Its still an insult, and that is what is against the rules. The only people who will cry over anything you mention are mentally ill. Most just think wow this kids throwing a hissy fit over a game, what an annoying baby. I dontwanna play with annoying kids, guess ill report him and hopefully never have to play with it again.

It's not that people are saddened or hurt by your insults. It is more that people are irritated. Irritation still causes stress, so you are making an already stressful situation more stressful.

It is not your job to point out percieved mistakes. Just play.
All of your behavior was very bad all the time and I'm actually surprised that this is the first time you've been punished if you make a habit of chatting like you did in these logs.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RXiRtAAn,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-07-22T12:26:20.645+0000)

and what do u mean "behavior was very bad"? is this game school or what? since when anyone cares about shit talk in a video game? this is the lowest level of toxicity, other people tell you to kill yourself and your family every game... and i am saying someone is "trash" why is that so bad? would u be offended if i call you trash in a stupid video game?

deserved every time
seems like this belongs here: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/rant
i say fucking all the fucking time, thats not why you are punished.

The system is poorly designed but ironically it's effective at dealing with people who are regularly abusive

I think that shouldn't be enough we need a second separate system adjacent to the old one that deals with people who are rarely toxic so riot won't be sending the ugly message that being toxic once a month is ok

Also integrating some context to both of them would be nice we are not bots to be punished by bots, we are humans context matters

I think the human reviewed cases are rare and they don't care about context even then lmao so it's no different than being banned by bots this needs to change
